example.name: prediction as utterance
example.text: He predicted that the board would give the current duo until early next year before naming a new chief executive.
example.arg: that the board would give the current duo until early next year before naming a new chief executive

example.name: prediction as noun phrase
example.text: Analysts were predicting 1990 BellSouth earnings in the range of $3.90 a share, or $1.9 billion, but now those estimates are being scaled back.
example.arg: 1990 BellSouth earnings in the range of $3.90 a share, or $1.9 billion

predicate.note: Frames file for 'predict' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No verbnet class. Loose comparison with verbs of saying.
